page.title: 02TRANSPORT, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: The Lincolnshire Road Car Company, part of the National Bus Company, runs services through{East Barkwith}and { {South Willingham,}on the Lincoln - Louth - coast route. The number of buses varies, with more in summer than in winter. A private company runs a service to and from Lincoln on Fridays. This passes through {East {Barkwith.}These are the only public services in the area. There are a number of private services, including the school bus, which takes children to the secondary school in Louth; an ambulance, which collects handicapped people for a weekly meeting in Wragby; several mini-buses which are run by employers; and the parish mini-bus, which collects over-sixties for their monthly meeting, and the choir on Sundays. Most people rely on private cars for work and shopping.
